results.title: Wings to the future
results.brief_description: Principle features and event of the 1962 Farmborough Air Show. British aircraft on display included the Hawker P-1277, Bristol Type 188, Vickers VC10, de Havilland Trident, de Havilland 125 jet and the Beagle 218. Many others craft are seen on the ground and in the air, and supersonic fighters of the Armed Services give a thrilling display of aerobatics as a finale.

results.title: Wings to Italy
results.creator_credit: Ideal Pictures (US), Coleman Productions and Harry L. Coleman
results.brief_description: Points of interest ot the tourist in Italy are seen as a young couple reminisce about their vacation trip. Includes Rome, Vesuvius, Pompeii, Capri, Pisa, Siena, Florence, the Dolomites and Venice.

results.title: Wings to Guatemala
results.creator_credit: International Film Productions, Stanley Toogood and Jean Oser
results.brief_description: A brief history of Guatemala is presented. The descendents of the Mayan Indians are shown on the shores of Lake Atillan, living a life that is largely based on ancient tradition. They work for six days on Chichicastenango to sell their goods and workshop their old Mayan gods on the steps on the church. Scenes are included of the modern city of Guatemala and the luxurious resorts set among the ruins of the past. The fondness of the people for music and traditional dancing is shown.

results.title: Wings to Central America and Mexico
results.brief_description: The scenery, industries, and life and customs of the inhabitants of the seven Central American countries, Mexico, Guatemala, Honduras, San Salvador, Nicaragua, Costa Rica, and Panama. South American Indians constitute a large percentage of the populations and the influence of the old Maya gods and the Spanish conquistadors influences their religion and their dances. The Panama Canal and lie in sophisticated Bilboa which is an opulent cosmopolitan city are shown. In Mexico there is a sharp contrast between life in the country and in Mexico City with its modern buildings as well as the architecture of old Colonial Spain. A popular pastime is bullfighting.

results.title: Wings to Bermuda
results.creator_credit: Pan American World Airways and Harry L. Coleman
results.brief_description: A young couple spend their honeymoon in Bermuda. The camera follows them as they observe the beauty of the island’s flower gardens, visit caves, play golf, swim, surf or water ski. Exploring the hidden world bellows the sea is a highlight of the tour, as is a midnight barbecue under a full Bermuda moon.

results.title: Wings over the navy
results.brief_description: This is the story of the Australian Naval Aviation - of the carrier HMAS Sydney - and of he intricate and intensive training given to the men who men her and the pilots who fly her aircraft.

results.title: Wings of Honneamise
results.creator_credit: Manga Entertainment, Hirohiko Sueyoshi, Hiroaki Inoue and Hiroyuki Yamaga
results.brief_description: An epic tale charting civilisation’s fascination with reaching the stars. Apathetic student Shirotsugu Lhadatt winds up in the Royal Space Force after bad grades destroy his dreams of entering the local airforce. Unfortunately, the Royal Space Force is little more than a motley group of young cadets and ageing scientists struggling to send man into space while suffering public ridicule, government wrangling, and a lack of resources. However, after Shiro crosses paths with devout missionary, Riquinni, he becomes determined to be the first man in space. Spurred on by his unrequited love for her, Shiro braves assassins, funding crises and the threat of war to make his dream of travelling to the stars a reality. A stunningly animated feature film. Some subtitles.

results.title: Wings of desire = Der Himmel uber Berlin
results.creator_credit: Argos Films, Road Movies Filmproduktion, Anatole Dauman and Wim Wenders
results.brief_description: Bruno Ganz is Daniel, an angel who flies above the city of Berlin, dreaming of experiencing the mortality of life, of touching flesh. He is entranced by the circus girl Marion (Solveig Dommartin) and an encounter with an ex-angel turned human actor (Peter Falk as himself), convinces Daniel to embrace mortality and seek the woman he loves. Wim Wenders’ return to Germany, after his turbulent experiences working in the United States, resulted in this rhapsodaisical, beautiful film which is as much a love poem to the city of Berlin as it is an optimistic celebration of human struggle and endeavour in the decay and confusion of post-war Europe. Elegantly photographed in black and white and in colour, the film features a music score by Nick Cave and the Bad Seeds, Crime and the City Solution and Tuxedo Moon.

results.title: Wings for tomorrow
results.brief_description: The importance of models in aviation is depicted, showing that although they give enjoyment to the enthusiasts who make and fly them, they also give very valuable training to designers, technicians, and flyers, both present and future. It shows how the crew members of today get their early graining, in many instances, flying models of yesterday. Various models from gliders to jets are shown, both on the ground, and in the air.
